title: Compile error when macro names start with identical strings
body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code:

```rust
fn main() {
    macroname2!();
}

macro_rules! macroname {
    ( $( $x:expr),* ) => {}
}
macro_rules! macroname2 {
    ( $( $x:expr),* ) => {}
}
```

I expected the compiler to find the macroname2 macro.

Instead, this happened:
```
error: cannot find macro `macroname2` in this scope
 --> src/main.rs:2:5
  |
2 |     macroname2!();
  |     ^^^^^^^^^^
  |
  = help: have you added the `#[macro_use]` on the module/import?

warning: unused macro definition: `macroname`
 --> src/main.rs:5:14
  |
5 | macro_rules! macroname {
  |              ^^^^^^^^^
  |
  = note: `#[warn(unused_macros)]` on by default

warning: unused macro definition: `macroname2`
 --> src/main.rs:8:14
  |
8 | macro_rules! macroname2 {
  |              ^^^^^^^^^^
```

### Meta
<!--
If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions.
-->

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.63.0 (4b91a6ea7 2022-08-08)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 4b91a6ea7258a947e59c6522cd5898e7c0a6a88f
commit-date: 2022-08-08
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.63.0
LLVM version: 14.0.5
```

I get the same result with nightly:
```
rustc 1.65.0-nightly (40336865f 2022-08-15)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 40336865fe7d4a01139a3336639c6971647e885c
commit-date: 2022-08-15
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.65.0-nightly
LLVM version: 15.0.0
```
